lustre/tests/badarea_io.c

00001 #include <stdio.h>
00002 #include <sys/types.h>
00003 #include <sys/stat.h>
00004 #include <fcntl.h>
00005 #include <unistd.h>
00006 
00007 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00008 {
00009         int rc;
00010         int fd = open(argv[1], O_WRONLY);
00011 
00012         if (fd == -1) {
00013                 perror(argv[1]);
00014                 goto read;
00015         }
00016 
00017         /* We need rc because Sles11 compiler warns against unchecked
00018          * return value of read and write */
00019         rc = write(fd, (void *)0x4096000, 5);
00020         if (rc != 5)
00021                 perror("write badarea (Should have failed)");
00022 
00023         rc = write(fd, &fd, 0);
00024         if (rc != 0)
00025                 perror("write zero bytes");
00026 
00027         rc = write(fd, &fd, 1);
00028         if (rc != 1)
00029                 perror("write one byte");
00030 
00031         rc = write(fd, &fd, 2UL*1024*1024);
00032         if (rc != 2UL*1024*1024)
00033                 perror("write 2M");
00034 
00035         rc = write(fd, &fd, 2UL*1024*1024*1024);
00036         if (rc != 2UL*1024*1024*1024)
00037                 perror("write 2G");
00038 
00039         rc = write(fd, &fd, -2);
00040         if (rc != -2)
00041                 perror("write -2");
00042 
00043         close(fd);
00044 
00045 read:
00046         fd = open(argv[1], O_RDONLY);
00047         if (fd == -1)
00048                 return 0;
00049         rc = read(fd, (void *)0x4096000, 5);
00050         perror("read");
00051 
00052         close(fd);
00053 
00054         /* Tame the compiler spooked about rc assigned, but not used */
00055         if (!rc)
00056                 return -1; /* Not really important. */
00057 
00058         return 0;
00059 }
